CVE-2024-56406
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-04-13T14:15:14.527000

2 posts

A heap buffer overflow vulnerability was discovered in Perl. When there are non-ASCII bytes in the left-hand-side of the `tr` operator, `S_do_trans_invmap` can overflow the destination pointer `d`. Â  Â $ perl -e '$_ = "\x{FF}" x 1000000; tr/\xFF/\x{100}/;' Â  Â Segmentation fault (core dumped) It is believed that this vulnerability can enable Denial of Service and possibly Code Execution attacks

harrysintonen at 2025-04-13T15:47:33.935Z ##

CVE-2024-56406: Perl 5.34, 5.36, 5.38 and 5.40 are vulnerable to a heap buffer overflow when transliterating non-ASCII bytes.

"When there are non-ASCII bytes in the left-hand-side of the tr operator, S_do_trans_invmap() can overflow the destination pointer d.

It is believed that this vulnerability can enable Denial of Service or Arbitrary Code Execution attacks on platforms that lack sufficient defenses."

ref: https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/04/13/3

https://metacpan.org/release/SHAY/perl-5.40.2/changes

It's suggested releases from v5.33.1 to v5.41.10 are affected: https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/04/13/4

#cve_2024_56406

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-13T15:47:33.000Z ##

CVE-2024-56406: Perl 5.34, 5.36, 5.38 and 5.40 are vulnerable to a heap buffer overflow when transliterating non-ASCII bytes.

"When there are non-ASCII bytes in the left-hand-side of the tr operator, S_do_trans_invmap() can overflow the destination pointer d.

It is believed that this vulnerability can enable Denial of Service or Arbitrary Code Execution attacks on platforms that lack sufficient defenses."

ref: https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/04/13/3

https://metacpan.org/release/SHAY/perl-5.40.2/changes

It's suggested releases from v5.33.1 to v5.41.10 are affected: https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/04/13/4

#cve_2024_56406

##

CVE-2025-3535
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.03%

updated 2025-04-13T11:15:14.723000

2 posts

A vulnerability has been found in shuanx BurpAPIFinder up to 2.0.2 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file BurpApiFinder.db. The manipulation leads to denial of service. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

cR0w at 2025-04-13T12:42:39.747Z ##

CVE published for a Burp plug-in? That's kind of cool. I don't remember seeing that before.

https://github.com/shuanx/BurpAPIFinder/issues/18#issue-2956026808

sev:MED 5.3 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:N/VI:N/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

A vulnerability has been found in shuanx BurpAPIFinder up to 2.0.2 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file BurpApiFinder.db. The manipulation leads to denial of service. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-3535

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-13T12:42:39.000Z ##

CVE published for a Burp plug-in? That's kind of cool. I don't remember seeing that before.

https://github.com/shuanx/BurpAPIFinder/issues/18#issue-2956026808

sev:MED 5.3 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:P/VC:N/VI:N/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

A vulnerability has been found in shuanx BurpAPIFinder up to 2.0.2 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file BurpApiFinder.db. The manipulation leads to denial of service. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-3535

##

CVE-2025-29834
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2025-04-12T03:30:35

2 posts

Out-of-bounds read in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) allows an unauthorized attacker to execute code over a network.

AAKL at 2025-04-12T15:50:41.863Z ##

Microsoft released this yesterday, tracked as CVE-2025-29834, rated at maximum severity.

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability New https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2025-29834 #Microsoft #cybersecurity #infosec

##

CVE-2025-23387
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2025-04-11T23:13:36

2 posts

### Impact A vulnerability has been identified within Rancher where it is possible for an unauthenticated user to list all CLI authentication tokens and delete them before the CLI is able to get the token value. This effectively prevents users from logging in via the CLI when using rancher token as the execution command (instead of the token directly being in the kubeconfig). Note that this toke

cR0w at 2025-04-11T13:21:09.704Z ##

SUSE rancher has some new CVEs. I'm still waking up and haven't read through them yet so I don't know if they're actually interesting or not.

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/security/advisories/GHSA-8p83-cpfg-fj3g

sev:CRIT 9.1 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

A Incorrect Privilege Assignment vulnerability in SUSE rancher allows a Restricted Administrator to change the password of Administrators and take over their accounts.
This issue affects rancher: from 2.8.0 before 2.8.14, from 2.9.0 before 2.9.8, from 2.10.0 before 2.10.4.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23391

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/security/advisories/GHSA-mq23-vvg7-xfm4

sev:HIGH 8.4 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:L

A Improper Access Control vulnerability in SUSE rancher allows a local user to impersonate other identities through SAML Authentication on first login.
This issue affects rancher: from 2.8.0 before 2.8.13, from 2.9.0 before 2.9.7, from 2.10.0 before 2.10.3.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23389

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/security/advisories/GHSA-xr9q-h9c7-xw8q

sev:HIGH 8.2 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H

A Stack-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability in SUSE rancher allows for denial of service.This issue affects rancher: from 2.8.0 before 2.8.13, from 2.9.0 before 2.9.7, from 2.10.0 before 2.10.3.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23388

https://github.com/rancher/steve/security/advisories/GHSA-j5hq-5jcr-xwx7

sev:HIGH 7.7 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:N

A Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in SUSE rancher which allows users to watch resources they are not allowed to access, when they have at least some generic permissions on the type.
This issue affects rancher: before 2175e09, before 6e30359, before c744f0b.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-52280

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/security/advisories/GHSA-9c5p-35gj-jqp4

sev:MED 6.2 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:N

A Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in SUSE rancher allowing any users with GET access to the Rancher Manager Apps Catalog to read any sensitive information that are contained within the Appsâ values. Additionally, the same information leaks into auditing logs when the audit level is set to equal or above 2.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-52282

CVE-2025-0123(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.01%

updated 2025-04-11T18:31:19

1 posts

A vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables unlicensed administrators to view clear-text data captured using the packet capture feature https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-0/pan-os-admin/monitoring/take-packet-captures/take-a-custom-packet-capture in decrypted HTTP/2 data streams traversing network interfaces on the firewall. HTTP/1.1 data streams are not impacted.

AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-09T17:33:03.000Z ##

New. This is a partial list. There are a lot more.

Palo Alto: CVE-2025-0120 GlobalProtect App: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability (Moderate Severity) https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0120

CVE-2025-0121 Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Crash the Agent https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0121

CVE-2025-0122 Prisma SD-WAN: Denial of Service (DoS) Vulnerability Through Burst of Crafted Packets https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0122

CVE-2025-0123 PAN-OS: Information Disclosure Vulnerability in HTTP/2 Packet Captures https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0123

CVE-2025-0124 PAN-OS: Authenticated File Deletion Vulnerability on the Management Web Interface https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0124

sev:CRIT 10.0 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H

Improper Input Validation vulnerability in The Wikimedia Foundation Mediawiki - Wikibase Media Info Extension allows Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).This issue affects Mediawiki - Wikibase Media Info Extension: from 1.39 through 1.43.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-32069

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T389590

sev:CRIT 10.0 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H

Improper Input Validation vulnerability in The Wikimedia Foundation Mediawiki - AJAX Poll Extension allows Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).This issue affects Mediawiki - AJAX Poll Extension: from 1.39 through 1.43.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-32070

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T389369

sev:CRIT 10.0 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H

Improper Input Validation vulnerability in The Wikimedia Foundation Mediawiki - Wikidata Extension allows Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) from widthheight message via ImageHandler::getDimensionsString()This issue affects Mediawiki - Wikidata Extension: from 1.39 through 1.43.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-32071

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T386908

sev:CRIT 10.0 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H

##

CVE-2025-23389
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2025-04-11T15:39:52.920000

2 posts

A Improper Access Control vulnerability in SUSE rancher allows a local user to impersonate other identities through SAML Authentication on first login. This issue affects rancher: from 2.8.0 before 2.8.13, from 2.9.0 before 2.9.7, from 2.10.0 before 2.10.3.

cR0w at 2025-04-11T13:21:09.704Z ##

SUSE rancher has some new CVEs. I'm still waking up and haven't read through them yet so I don't know if they're actually interesting or not.

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/security/advisories/GHSA-8p83-cpfg-fj3g

sev:CRIT 9.1 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

A Incorrect Privilege Assignment vulnerability in SUSE rancher allows a Restricted Administrator to change the password of Administrators and take over their accounts.
This issue affects rancher: from 2.8.0 before 2.8.14, from 2.9.0 before 2.9.8, from 2.10.0 before 2.10.4.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23391

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/security/advisories/GHSA-mq23-vvg7-xfm4

sev:HIGH 8.4 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:L

A Improper Access Control vulnerability in SUSE rancher allows a local user to impersonate other identities through SAML Authentication on first login.
This issue affects rancher: from 2.8.0 before 2.8.13, from 2.9.0 before 2.9.7, from 2.10.0 before 2.10.3.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23389

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/security/advisories/GHSA-xr9q-h9c7-xw8q

sev:HIGH 8.2 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H

A Stack-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability in SUSE rancher allows for denial of service.This issue affects rancher: from 2.8.0 before 2.8.13, from 2.9.0 before 2.9.7, from 2.10.0 before 2.10.3.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23388

https://github.com/rancher/steve/security/advisories/GHSA-j5hq-5jcr-xwx7

sev:HIGH 7.7 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:N

A Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in SUSE rancher which allows users to watch resources they are not allowed to access, when they have at least some generic permissions on the type.
This issue affects rancher: before 2175e09, before 6e30359, before c744f0b.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-52280

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/security/advisories/GHSA-9c5p-35gj-jqp4

sev:MED 6.2 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:N

A Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in SUSE rancher allowing any users with GET access to the Rancher Manager Apps Catalog to read any sensitive information that are contained within the Appsâ values. Additionally, the same information leaks into auditing logs when the audit level is set to equal or above 2.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-52282

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/security/advisories/GHSA-5qmp-9x47-92q8

sev:MED 5.3 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L

A Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in SUSE rancher allowed unauthenticated users to list all CLI authentication tokens and delete them before the CLI is able to get the token value.This issue affects rancher: from 2.8.0 before 2.8.13, from 2.9.0 before 2.9.7, from 2.10.0 before 2.10.3.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23387

A Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in SUSE rancher allowing any users with GET access to the Rancher Manager Apps Catalog to read any sensitive information that are contained within the Appsâ values. Additionally, the same information leaks into auditing logs when the audit level is set to equal or above 2.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-52282

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/security/advisories/GHSA-5qmp-9x47-92q8

sev:MED 5.3 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L

A Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in SUSE rancher allowed unauthenticated users to list all CLI authentication tokens and delete them before the CLI is able to get the token value.This issue affects rancher: from 2.8.0 before 2.8.13, from 2.9.0 before 2.9.7, from 2.10.0 before 2.10.3.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23387

##

CVE-2025-23359
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-04-11T15:32:26

1 posts

NVIDIA Container Toolkit for Linux contains a Time-of-Check Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) vulnerability when used with default configuration, where a crafted container image could gain access to the host file system. A successful exploit of this vulnerability might lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, information disclosure, and data tampering.

0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-10T16:19:32.000Z ##

Ugh, the NVIDIA Container Toolkit saga continues... First, we had the headache of CVE-2024-0132, and now *this*? Apparently, Trend Micro's saying the patch wasn't quite the fix we thought it was. Enter CVE-2025-23359. So yeah, container escape is still potentially on the table... ð

As a pentester, honestly, I run into this kind of thinking way too often: "Just slap on the patch, we're golden!" But it's rarely that simple, right? You know the drill â issues like TOCTOU, sketchy `mount_files` configurations, or just plain missing locking mechanisms... Attackers absolutely *love* finding these gaps. Itâs often a straightforward path to privilege escalation and, ultimately, compromising the entire host system. A classic scenario, unfortunately.

What about you folks? Have you wrestled with similar container security nightmares? More importantly, what tools or techniques are you finding helpful to spot these kinds of vulnerabilities before they become a real problem?

Drop your experiences and favorite tools below!

##

CVE-2025-32107
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.40%

updated 2025-04-11T09:30:28

2 posts

OS command injection vulnerability exists in Deco BE65 Pro firmware versions prior to "Deco BE65 Pro(JP)_V1_1.1.2 Build 20250123". If this vulnerability is exploited, an arbitrary OS command may be executed by the user who can log in to the device.

cR0w at 2025-04-11T13:29:49.196Z ##

Command injection in TP-LINK Deco BE65 Pro. It has "Pro" in its name so someone probably has it in their inventory or their target list. No PoC though.

OS command injection vulnerability exists in Deco BE65 Pro firmware versions prior to "Deco BE65 Pro(JP)_V1_1.1.2 Build 20250123". If this vulnerability is exploited, an arbitrary OS command may be executed by the user who can log in to the device.

CVE-2025-0120(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.01%

updated 2025-04-11T04:19:34

5 posts

A vulnerability with a privilege management mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtectâ¢ app on Windows devices allows a locally authenticated non-administrative Windows user to escalate their privileges to NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM. However, execution requires that the local user can also successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

AAKL at 2025-04-12T15:52:46.364Z ##

Also from yesterday.

Palo Alro: CVE-2025-0120 GlobalProtect App: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability (moderate severity) https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0120 #cybersecurity #Infosec

##
cR0w at 2025-04-11T13:55:16.116Z ##

Fucking Palo. They are the CNA for these vulns, so you would think they would be submitting the same CVSS scores that they used in their advisory, right? sigh

I mean, I understand the idea of using CVSS-BT scores, but simply listing it as the CVSS score throws off vuln management that relies on those scores. Is that a larger problem than PAN using a more nuanced score? Yes. But when the CVE doesn't match the advisory, it creates even more work for defenders when engineers say "PAN says it's just a sev:MED so we're not rushing a patch" even when you demonstrate that it's more applicable to your environment than the generic score would indicate.

And I know it's not new, it just really irked me this morning. ð

https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/

sev:HIGH 8.7 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:Y/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 6.6 in their advisory )

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in the Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) authentication feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an unauthenticated attacker to initiate system reboots using a maliciously crafted packet. Repeated attempts to initiate a reboot causes the firewall to enter maintenance mode. Cloud NGFW is not affected by this vulnerability. PrismaÂ® Access software is proactively patched and protected from this issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0128

sev:HIGH - 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:P/PR:H/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.0 in their advisory )

A command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated administrator to bypass system restrictions and run arbitrary commands as a root user. This issue is only applicable to PAN-OS VM-Series. This issue does not affect firewalls that are already deployed.

Cloud NGFW and PrismaÂ® Access are not affected by this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0127

sev:HIGH 8.3 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:N/VI:L/VA:H/SC:H/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 5.6 in their advisory )

When configured using SAML, a session fixation vulnerability in the GlobalProtectâ¢ login enables an attacker to impersonate a legitimate authorized user and perform actions as that GlobalProtect user. This requires the legitimate user to first click on a malicious link provided by the attacker.

The SAML login for the PAN-OSÂ® management interface is not affected. Additionally, this issue does not affect Cloud NGFW and all PrismaÂ® Access instances are proactively patched.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0126

sev:MED 6.9 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:P/VC:H/VI:L/VA:N/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/S:N/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.4 in their advisory )

An improper input neutralization vulnerability in the management web interface of the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables a malicious authenticated read-write administrator to impersonate another legitimate authenticated PAN-OS administrator.

The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 .

This issue does not affect Cloud NGFW and all PrismaÂ® Access instances.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0125

sev:MED 5.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 2.0 in their advisory )

An authenticated file deletion vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to delete certain files as the ânobodyâ user; this includes limited logs and configuration files but does not include system files. The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 . This issue affects Cloud NGFW. However, this issue does not affect PrismaÂ® Access software.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0124

sev:MED 5.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:P/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:Y/R:A/V:D/RE:L/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.9 in their advisory )

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PrismaÂ® SD-WAN ION devices enables an unauthenticated attacker in a network adjacent to a Prisma SD-WAN ION device to disrupt the packet processing capabilities of the device by sending a burst of crafted packets to that device.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0122

sev:MED 6.8 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.3 in their advisory )

A null pointer dereference vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks CortexÂ® XDR agent on Windows devices allows a low-privileged local Windows user to crash the agent. Additionally, malware can use this vulnerability to perform malicious activity without Cortex XDR being able to detect it.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0121

sev:HIGH 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:H/VA:N/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.0 in their advisory )

However, execution requires that the local user can also successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0120

I mean, I understand the idea of using CVSS-BT scores, but simply listing it as the CVSS score throws off vuln management that relies on those scores. Is that a larger problem than PAN using a more nuanced score? Yes. But when the CVE doesn't match the advisory, it creates even more work for defenders when engineers say "PAN says it's just a sev:MED so we're not rushing a patch" even when you demonstrate that it's more applicable to your environment than the generic score would indicate.

And I know it's not new, it just really irked me this morning. ð

https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/

sev:HIGH 8.7 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:Y/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 6.6 in their advisory )

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in the Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) authentication feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an unauthenticated attacker to initiate system reboots using a maliciously crafted packet. Repeated attempts to initiate a reboot causes the firewall to enter maintenance mode. Cloud NGFW is not affected by this vulnerability. PrismaÂ® Access software is proactively patched and protected from this issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0128

sev:HIGH - 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:P/PR:H/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.0 in their advisory )

A command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated administrator to bypass system restrictions and run arbitrary commands as a root user. This issue is only applicable to PAN-OS VM-Series. This issue does not affect firewalls that are already deployed.

Cloud NGFW and PrismaÂ® Access are not affected by this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0127

sev:HIGH 8.3 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:N/VI:L/VA:H/SC:H/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 5.6 in their advisory )

When configured using SAML, a session fixation vulnerability in the GlobalProtectâ¢ login enables an attacker to impersonate a legitimate authorized user and perform actions as that GlobalProtect user. This requires the legitimate user to first click on a malicious link provided by the attacker.

The SAML login for the PAN-OSÂ® management interface is not affected. Additionally, this issue does not affect Cloud NGFW and all PrismaÂ® Access instances are proactively patched.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0126

sev:MED 6.9 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:P/VC:H/VI:L/VA:N/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/S:N/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.4 in their advisory )

An improper input neutralization vulnerability in the management web interface of the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables a malicious authenticated read-write administrator to impersonate another legitimate authenticated PAN-OS administrator.

The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 .

This issue does not affect Cloud NGFW and all PrismaÂ® Access instances.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0125

sev:MED 5.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 2.0 in their advisory )

An authenticated file deletion vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to delete certain files as the ânobodyâ user; this includes limited logs and configuration files but does not include system files. The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 . This issue affects Cloud NGFW. However, this issue does not affect PrismaÂ® Access software.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0124

sev:MED 5.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:P/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:Y/R:A/V:D/RE:L/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.9 in their advisory )

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PrismaÂ® SD-WAN ION devices enables an unauthenticated attacker in a network adjacent to a Prisma SD-WAN ION device to disrupt the packet processing capabilities of the device by sending a burst of crafted packets to that device.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0122

sev:MED 6.8 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.3 in their advisory )

A null pointer dereference vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks CortexÂ® XDR agent on Windows devices allows a low-privileged local Windows user to crash the agent. Additionally, malware can use this vulnerability to perform malicious activity without Cortex XDR being able to detect it.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0121

sev:HIGH 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:H/VA:N/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.0 in their advisory )

A vulnerability with a privilege management mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtectâ¢ app on Windows devices allows a locally authenticated non-administrative Windows user to escalate their privileges to NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM. However, execution requires that the local user can also successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0120

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-11T13:55:16.000Z ##

Fucking Palo. They are the CNA for these vulns, so you would think they would be submitting the same CVSS scores that they used in their advisory, right? sigh

##

CVE-2025-0127(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.13%

updated 2025-04-11T04:19:33

2 posts

A command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated administrator to bypass system restrictions and run arbitrary commands as a root user. This issue is only applicable to PAN-OS VM-Series. This issue does not affect firewalls that are already deployed. Cloud NGFW and PrismaÂ® Access are not affected by this vulnerability.

cR0w at 2025-04-11T13:55:16.116Z ##

Fucking Palo. They are the CNA for these vulns, so you would think they would be submitting the same CVSS scores that they used in their advisory, right? sigh

I mean, I understand the idea of using CVSS-BT scores, but simply listing it as the CVSS score throws off vuln management that relies on those scores. Is that a larger problem than PAN using a more nuanced score? Yes. But when the CVE doesn't match the advisory, it creates even more work for defenders when engineers say "PAN says it's just a sev:MED so we're not rushing a patch" even when you demonstrate that it's more applicable to your environment than the generic score would indicate.

And I know it's not new, it just really irked me this morning. ð

https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/

sev:HIGH 8.7 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:Y/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 6.6 in their advisory )

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in the Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) authentication feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an unauthenticated attacker to initiate system reboots using a maliciously crafted packet. Repeated attempts to initiate a reboot causes the firewall to enter maintenance mode. Cloud NGFW is not affected by this vulnerability. PrismaÂ® Access software is proactively patched and protected from this issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0128

sev:HIGH - 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:P/PR:H/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.0 in their advisory )

A command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated administrator to bypass system restrictions and run arbitrary commands as a root user. This issue is only applicable to PAN-OS VM-Series. This issue does not affect firewalls that are already deployed.

Cloud NGFW and PrismaÂ® Access are not affected by this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0127

sev:HIGH 8.3 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:N/VI:L/VA:H/SC:H/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 5.6 in their advisory )

When configured using SAML, a session fixation vulnerability in the GlobalProtectâ¢ login enables an attacker to impersonate a legitimate authorized user and perform actions as that GlobalProtect user. This requires the legitimate user to first click on a malicious link provided by the attacker.

The SAML login for the PAN-OSÂ® management interface is not affected. Additionally, this issue does not affect Cloud NGFW and all PrismaÂ® Access instances are proactively patched.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0126

sev:MED 6.9 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:P/VC:H/VI:L/VA:N/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/S:N/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.4 in their advisory )

An improper input neutralization vulnerability in the management web interface of the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables a malicious authenticated read-write administrator to impersonate another legitimate authenticated PAN-OS administrator.

The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 .

This issue does not affect Cloud NGFW and all PrismaÂ® Access instances.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0125

sev:MED 5.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 2.0 in their advisory )

An authenticated file deletion vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to delete certain files as the ânobodyâ user; this includes limited logs and configuration files but does not include system files. The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 . This issue affects Cloud NGFW. However, this issue does not affect PrismaÂ® Access software.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0124

sev:MED 5.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:P/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:Y/R:A/V:D/RE:L/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.9 in their advisory )

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PrismaÂ® SD-WAN ION devices enables an unauthenticated attacker in a network adjacent to a Prisma SD-WAN ION device to disrupt the packet processing capabilities of the device by sending a burst of crafted packets to that device.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0122

sev:MED 6.8 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.3 in their advisory )

A null pointer dereference vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks CortexÂ® XDR agent on Windows devices allows a low-privileged local Windows user to crash the agent. Additionally, malware can use this vulnerability to perform malicious activity without Cortex XDR being able to detect it.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0121

sev:HIGH 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:H/VA:N/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.0 in their advisory )

A vulnerability with a privilege management mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtectâ¢ app on Windows devices allows a locally authenticated non-administrative Windows user to escalate their privileges to NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM. However, execution requires that the local user can also successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0120

CVE-2025-0124(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2025-04-11T04:19:33

3 posts

An authenticated file deletion vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to delete certain files as the ânobodyâ user; this includes limited logs and configuration files but does not include system files. The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue.

cR0w at 2025-04-11T13:55:16.116Z ##

Fucking Palo. They are the CNA for these vulns, so you would think they would be submitting the same CVSS scores that they used in their advisory, right? sigh

I mean, I understand the idea of using CVSS-BT scores, but simply listing it as the CVSS score throws off vuln management that relies on those scores. Is that a larger problem than PAN using a more nuanced score? Yes. But when the CVE doesn't match the advisory, it creates even more work for defenders when engineers say "PAN says it's just a sev:MED so we're not rushing a patch" even when you demonstrate that it's more applicable to your environment than the generic score would indicate.

And I know it's not new, it just really irked me this morning. ð

PrismaÂ® Access software is proactively patched and protected from this issue.

You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 .

A null pointer dereference vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks CortexÂ® XDR agent on Windows devices allows a low-privileged local Windows user to crash the agent. Additionally, malware can use this vulnerability to perform malicious activity without Cortex XDR being able to detect it.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0121

sev:HIGH 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:H/VA:N/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.0 in their advisory )

A vulnerability with a privilege management mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtectâ¢ app on Windows devices allows a locally authenticated non-administrative Windows user to escalate their privileges to NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM. However, execution requires that the local user can also successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0120

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-09T17:33:03.000Z ##

New. This is a partial list. There are a lot more.

Palo Alto: CVE-2025-0120 GlobalProtect App: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability (Moderate Severity) https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0120

CVE-2025-0121 Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Crash the Agent https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0121

CVE-2025-0122 Prisma SD-WAN: Denial of Service (DoS) Vulnerability Through Burst of Crafted Packets https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0122

CVE-2025-0123 PAN-OS: Information Disclosure Vulnerability in HTTP/2 Packet Captures https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0123

CVE-2025-0124 PAN-OS: Authenticated File Deletion Vulnerability on the Management Web Interface https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0124
@paloaltontwks #cybersecurity #Infosec

##

CVE-2025-0125(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-04-11T04:19:33

2 posts

An improper input neutralization vulnerability in the management web interface of the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables a malicious authenticated read-write administrator to impersonate another legitimate authenticated PAN-OS administrator. The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricti

cR0w at 2025-04-11T13:55:16.116Z ##

Fucking Palo. They are the CNA for these vulns, so you would think they would be submitting the same CVSS scores that they used in their advisory, right? sigh

I mean, I understand the idea of using CVSS-BT scores, but simply listing it as the CVSS score throws off vuln management that relies on those scores. Is that a larger problem than PAN using a more nuanced score? Yes. But when the CVE doesn't match the advisory, it creates even more work for defenders when engineers say "PAN says it's just a sev:MED so we're not rushing a patch" even when you demonstrate that it's more applicable to your environment than the generic score would indicate.

And I know it's not new, it just really irked me this morning. ð

https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/

sev:HIGH 8.7 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:Y/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 6.6 in their advisory )

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in the Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) authentication feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an unauthenticated attacker to initiate system reboots using a maliciously crafted packet. Repeated attempts to initiate a reboot causes the firewall to enter maintenance mode. Cloud NGFW is not affected by this vulnerability. PrismaÂ® Access software is proactively patched and protected from this issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0128

sev:HIGH - 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:P/PR:H/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.0 in their advisory )

A command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated administrator to bypass system restrictions and run arbitrary commands as a root user. This issue is only applicable to PAN-OS VM-Series. This issue does not affect firewalls that are already deployed.

Cloud NGFW and PrismaÂ® Access are not affected by this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0127

sev:HIGH 8.3 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:N/VI:L/VA:H/SC:H/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 5.6 in their advisory )

When configured using SAML, a session fixation vulnerability in the GlobalProtectâ¢ login enables an attacker to impersonate a legitimate authorized user and perform actions as that GlobalProtect user. This requires the legitimate user to first click on a malicious link provided by the attacker.

The SAML login for the PAN-OSÂ® management interface is not affected. Additionally, this issue does not affect Cloud NGFW and all PrismaÂ® Access instances are proactively patched.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0126

sev:MED 6.9 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:P/VC:H/VI:L/VA:N/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/S:N/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.4 in their advisory )

An improper input neutralization vulnerability in the management web interface of the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables a malicious authenticated read-write administrator to impersonate another legitimate authenticated PAN-OS administrator.

The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 .

This issue does not affect Cloud NGFW and all PrismaÂ® Access instances.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0125

sev:MED 5.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 2.0 in their advisory )

An authenticated file deletion vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to delete certain files as the ânobodyâ user; this includes limited logs and configuration files but does not include system files. The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 . This issue affects Cloud NGFW. However, this issue does not affect PrismaÂ® Access software.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0124

sev:MED 5.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:P/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:Y/R:A/V:D/RE:L/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.9 in their advisory )

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PrismaÂ® SD-WAN ION devices enables an unauthenticated attacker in a network adjacent to a Prisma SD-WAN ION device to disrupt the packet processing capabilities of the device by sending a burst of crafted packets to that device.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0122

sev:MED 6.8 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.3 in their advisory )

A null pointer dereference vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks CortexÂ® XDR agent on Windows devices allows a low-privileged local Windows user to crash the agent. Additionally, malware can use this vulnerability to perform malicious activity without Cortex XDR being able to detect it.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0121

sev:HIGH 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:H/VA:N/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.0 in their advisory )

A vulnerability with a privilege management mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtectâ¢ app on Windows devices allows a locally authenticated non-administrative Windows user to escalate their privileges to NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM. However, execution requires that the local user can also successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0120

sev:MED 5.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:L/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 2.0 in their advisory )

An authenticated file deletion vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to delete certain files as the ânobodyâ user; this includes limited logs and configuration files but does not include system files. The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 . This issue affects Cloud NGFW. However, this issue does not affect PrismaÂ® Access software.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0124

sev:MED 5.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:P/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:Y/R:A/V:D/RE:L/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.9 in their advisory )

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PrismaÂ® SD-WAN ION devices enables an unauthenticated attacker in a network adjacent to a Prisma SD-WAN ION device to disrupt the packet processing capabilities of the device by sending a burst of crafted packets to that device.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0122

sev:MED 6.8 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.3 in their advisory )

A null pointer dereference vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks CortexÂ® XDR agent on Windows devices allows a low-privileged local Windows user to crash the agent. Additionally, malware can use this vulnerability to perform malicious activity without Cortex XDR being able to detect it.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0121

sev:HIGH 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:L/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:H/VA:N/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.0 in their advisory )

A vulnerability with a privilege management mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtectâ¢ app on Windows devices allows a locally authenticated non-administrative Windows user to escalate their privileges to NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM. However, execution requires that the local user can also successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0120

##

CVE-2025-0122(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.01%

updated 2025-04-11T04:19:33

3 posts

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PrismaÂ® SD-WAN ION devices enables an unauthenticated attacker in a network adjacent to a Prisma SD-WAN ION device to disrupt the packet processing capabilities of the device by sending a burst of crafted packets to that device.

cR0w at 2025-04-11T13:55:16.116Z ##

Fucking Palo. They are the CNA for these vulns, so you would think they would be submitting the same CVSS scores that they used in their advisory, right? sigh

I mean, I understand the idea of using CVSS-BT scores, but simply listing it as the CVSS score throws off vuln management that relies on those scores. Is that a larger problem than PAN using a more nuanced score? Yes. But when the CVE doesn't match the advisory, it creates even more work for defenders when engineers say "PAN says it's just a sev:MED so we're not rushing a patch" even when you demonstrate that it's more applicable to your environment than the generic score would indicate.

And I know it's not new, it just really irked me this morning. ð

https://security.paloaltonetworks.com/

sev:HIGH 8.7 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/AU:Y/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 6.6 in their advisory )

A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in the Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) authentication feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an unauthenticated attacker to initiate system reboots using a maliciously crafted packet. Repeated attempts to initiate a reboot causes the firewall to enter maintenance mode. Cloud NGFW is not affected by this vulnerability. PrismaÂ® Access software is proactively patched and protected from this issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0128

A command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables an authenticated administrator to bypass system restrictions and run arbitrary commands as a root user. This issue is only applicable to PAN-OS VM-Series. This issue does not affect firewalls that are already deployed.

Cloud NGFW and PrismaÂ® Access are not affected by this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0127

sev:HIGH 8.3 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:A/VC:N/VI:L/VA:H/SC:H/SI:N/SA:N/AU:N/R:U/V:D/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 5.6 in their advisory )

When configured using SAML, a session fixation vulnerability in the GlobalProtectâ¢ login enables an attacker to impersonate a legitimate authorized user and perform actions as that GlobalProtect user. This requires the legitimate user to first click on a malicious link provided by the attacker.

The SAML login for the PAN-OSÂ® management interface is not affected. Additionally, this issue does not affect Cloud NGFW and all PrismaÂ® Access instances are proactively patched.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0126

sev:MED 6.9 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:P/VC:H/VI:L/VA:N/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/S:N/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Amber ( Listed as 4.4 in their advisory )

An improper input neutralization vulnerability in the management web interface of the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OSÂ® software enables a malicious authenticated read-write administrator to impersonate another legitimate authenticated PAN-OS administrator.

The attacker must have network access to the management web interface to exploit this issue. You greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended critical deployment guidelines https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 .

This issue does not affect Cloud NGFW and all PrismaÂ® Access instances.

##

CVE-2025-22232
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.03%

updated 2025-04-10T18:32:03

1 posts

Spring Cloud Config Server may not use Vault token sent by clients using a X-CONFIG-TOKENÂ header when making requests to Vault. Your application may be affected by this if the following are true: * You have Spring Vault on the classpath of your Spring Cloud Config Server and * You are using the X-CONFIG-TOKENÂ header to send a Vault token to the Spring Cloud Config Server for the Config Serve

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-10T18:34:23.000Z ##

Spring Cloud Config Server with an interesting but probably unlikely scenario. Basically, if I understand it correctly, the SessionManager accepts the first token it receives and continues to use that token for subsequent requests, regardless of whether they contain a new token or any token.

https://spring.io/security/cve-2025-22232

sev:MED 5.3 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N

Spring Cloud Config Server may not use Vault token sent by clients using a X-CONFIG-TOKEN header when making requests to Vault.
Your application may be affected by this if the following are true:

  • You have Spring Vault on the classpath of your Spring Cloud Config Server and
  • You are using the X-CONFIG-TOKEN header to send a Vault token to the Spring Cloud Config Server for the Config Server to use when making requests to Vault and
  • You are using the default Spring Vault SessionManager implementation LifecycleAwareSessionManager or a SessionManager implementation that persists the Vault token such as SimpleSessionManager.

In this case the SessionManager persists the first token it retrieves and will continue to use that token even if client requests to the Spring Cloud Config Server include a X-CONFIG-TOKEN header with a different value.
Affected Spring Products and Versions
Spring Cloud Config:

  • 2.2.1.RELEASE - 4.2.1

Mitigation
Users of affected versions should upgrade to the corresponding fixed version.

Affected version(s)Fix versionAvailability4.2.x4.2.2OSS4.1.x4.1.6OSS4.0.x4.0.10Commercial3.1.x3.1.10Commercial3.0.x4.1.6OSS2.2.x4.1.6OSS
NOTE: Spring Cloud Config 3.0.x and 2.2.x are no longer under open source or commercial support. Users of these versions are encouraged to upgrade to a supported version.

No other mitigation steps are necessary.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22232

##

CVE-2025-30406
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 35.89%

updated 2025-04-10T16:19:51.107000

6 posts

Gladinet CentreStack through 16.1.10296.56315 (fixed in 16.4.10315.56368) has a deserialization vulnerability due to the CentreStack portal's hardcoded machineKey use, as exploited in the wild in March 2025. This enables threat actors (who know the machineKey) to serialize a payload for server-side deserialization to achieve remote code execution. NOTE: a CentreStack admin can manually delete the

beyondmachines1@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-09T15:01:27.000Z ##

Critical vulnerability in Gladinet CentreStack and Triofox (CVE-2025-30406) actively exploited
#cybersecurity #infosec #advisory #vulnerability
https://beyondmachines.net/event_details/critical-vulnerability-in-gladinet-centrestack-and-triofox-cve-2025-30406-actively-exploited-o-a-g-a-z/gD2P6Ple2L

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-09T12:33:13.000Z ##

Whoa, heads up everyone! CISA just added CVE-2025-30406 in Gladinet CentreStack to their list of vulnerabilities known to be actively exploited right now. ð¨ We're talking an RCE vulnerability here, apparently due to hardcoded keys! ðð¤¦ââï¸ Seriously?

It's the classic story, isn't it? You think everything's buttoned up and secure, then BAM â an unpatched vulnerability pops up. As someone knee-deep in pentesting, I unfortunately see this kind of oversight far too often. Let's be real, hardcoded keys are basically like leaving the front door wide open. ð´

So, what's the game plan? You need to update to version **16.4.10315.56368 IMMEDIATELY**. Don't wait on this! If updating isn't instantly possible for some reason, rotating the MachineKey could serve as a temporary band-aid â but it's definitely not a long-term fix. Also, get into the habit of regularly checking those configuration files!

Now, I'm curious: Are any of you using Gladinet? Have you been affected by this? What are your go-to tools for monitoring these kinds of issues? And hey, ever stumbled across hardcoded keys in your own adventures? Share your thoughts and experiences below! ð

#ITSecurity #Pentesting #RCE #Cybersecurity #VulnerabilityManagement

##

CVE-2024-53150
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.45%

updated 2025-04-10T15:39:07.530000

11 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA: usb-audio: Fix out of bounds reads when finding clock sources The current USB-audio driver code doesn't check bLength of each descriptor at traversing for clock descriptors. That is, when a device provides a bogus descriptor with a shorter bLength, the driver might hit out-of-bounds reads. For addressing it, this patch a

kernellogger@fosstodon.org at 2025-04-11T07:29:17.000Z ##

@ptesarik thx, I was more looking for a general answer I can apply in other situations, but those links helped me to find it afaics:

Go to a page like https://www.suse.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-53150.html and follow the links to "SUSE Security Advisories" - and then search those pages for "live patching"

Thx again!

##
ptesarik@fosstodon.org at 2025-04-11T07:18:34.000Z ##

@kernellogger Let me answer for SUSE.
CVE-2024-53150 was fixed in this update (2025-01-24T17:02:47Z):
https://www.suse.com/support/update/announcement/2025/suse-su-20250236-1/

CVE-2024-53197 was fixed in this update (2025-02-17T13:28:40Z):
https://www.suse.com/es-es/support/update/announcement/2025/suse-su-20250565-1/

EDIT: Just noticed you were asking for the method. You can always start here:
https://security.suse.com/

And CVE-2024-53150: https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-53150 #CISA #Linux #cybersecurity #infosec

2/ Side note: looks like both those #Linux #kernel vulnerabilities that CISA recently added to its catalog after three months are not yet fully fixed in #Ubuntu 24.04. ð²

##
kernellogger@fosstodon.org at 2025-04-10T10:12:26.000Z ##

Out of curiosity:

Does anyone know how to check when #Linux distributions with #LinuxKernel live patching services (like RHEL, SLE, or Ubuntu) rolled out live patches for certain CVEs?

Asking, as I noticed that CISA recently added two known exploited #kernel vulnerabilities to its catalog[1] which upstream fixed more than three months ago[2, 3]. And that made me wonder when live patches for those went out.

[1] https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/04/09/cisa-adds-two-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

[2] https://lore.kernel.org/linux-cve-announce/2024122427-CVE-2024-53150-3a7d@gregkh/

[3] https://lore.kernel.org/linux-cve-announce/2024122725-CVE-2024-53197-6aef@gregkh/

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-09T19:04:22.000Z ##

I missed that CVE-2024-53150 was also added to the KEV catalog. Patch those drivers, even if they don't seem likely to be exploited, like USB and / or audio drivers.

sev:HIGH 7.8 - CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA: usb-audio: Fix potential out-of-bound accesses for Extigy and Mbox devices A bogus device can provide a bNumConfigurations value that exceeds the initial value used in usb_get_configuration for allocating dev->config. This can lead to out-of-bounds accesses later, e.g. in usb_destroy_configuration.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-53197#VulnChangeHistorySection

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2025-04-09T19:00:56.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-53150
Vendor: Linux
Product: Kernel
Date Added: 2025-04-09
Vulnerability: Linux Kernel Out-of-Bounds Read Vulnerability
Notes: This vulnerability affects a common open-source component, third-party library, or a protocol used by different products. For more information, please see: https://lore.kernel.org/linux-cve-announce/2024122427-CVE-2024-53150-3a7d@gregkh/ ; https://source.android.com/docs/security/bulletin/2025-04-01 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-53150
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-53150

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-09T18:22:21.000Z ##

CISA added CVE-2024-53150 to the KEV catalog.

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA: usb-audio: Fix out of bounds reads when finding clock sources The current USB-audio driver code doesn't check bLength of each descriptor at traversing for clock descriptors. That is, when a device provides a bogus descriptor with a shorter bLength, the driver might hit out-of-bounds reads. For addressing it, this patch adds sanity checks to the validator functions for the clock descriptor traversal. When the descriptor length is shorter than expected, it's skipped in the loop. For the clock source and clock multiplier descriptors, we can just check bLength against the sizeof() of each descriptor type. OTOH, the clock selector descriptor of UAC2 and UAC3 has an array of bNrInPins elements and two more fields at its tail, hence those have to be checked in addition to the sizeof() check.

Interestingly, the NVD and NIST disagreed on the vector. NVD rated it as sev:HIGH 7.1 - CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H while CISA-ADP updated it two days ago as sev:HIGH 7.8 - CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-53150

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-08T14:44:30.000Z ##

If you missed this:

Android Security BulletinâApril 2025 https://source.android.com/docs/security/bulletin/2025-04-01

More:

Security Week: Google patches two Android vulnerabilities - CVE-2024-53150 and CVE-2024-53197 https://www.securityweek.com/android-update-patches-two-exploited-vulnerabilities/ @SecurityWeek #Android #Google #cybersecurity #infosec

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-08T12:31:59.000Z ##

The flaws, tracked as CVE-2024-53150 and CVE-2024-53197, impact the ALSA: usb-audio component and were addressed in the Linux kernel in December 2024. https://www.securityweek.com/android-update-patches-two-exploited-vulnerabilities/

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-08T08:19:57.000Z ##

Whoa, Google's been busy patching again! They just dropped fixes for a whopping 62 vulnerabilities! ð¤¯

And get this: attackers are *already* actively exploiting two of them. This affects Android devices, specifically targeting USB and Kernel components. We're talking technical stuff like Out-of-Bounds reads and Privilege Escalation... Sounds complicated, I know. But *basically*, it means bad actors could potentially gain more control over a device than they should.

The specific vulnerabilities getting attention are CVE-2024-53150 and CVE-2024-53197. What's particularly concerning is that Amnesty International reportedly found connections between these exploits and targeted attacks on activists. That's pretty serious!

So, what's the bottom line here? Folks, keeping your Android updated isn't just a suggestion â it's absolutely essential! Plus, don't sleep on USB security; it's more important than you might think.

Speaking as a pentester, I can tell you that your standard automated scans often miss these kinds of tricky vulnerabilities. Finding them usually requires digging in manually.

Have you ever encountered any USB-based attacks? How are you keeping your Android devices safe these days? Curious to hear your thoughts! ð¤

#AndroidSecurity #Pentesting #Cybersecurity

##

CVE-2025-32754
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.03%

updated 2025-04-10T15:32:51

1 posts

In jenkins/ssh-agent Docker images 6.11.1 and earlier, SSH host keys are generated on image creation for images based on Debian, causing all containers based on images of the same version use the same SSH host keys, allowing attackers able to insert themselves into the network path between the SSH client (typically the Jenkins controller) and SSH build agent to impersonate the latter.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-10T13:50:04.000Z ##

Well these Jenkins SSH CVEs in their Docker images don't look ideal. Good thing no one has been warning Docker / container devs about these issues for years ( says the crow still shaking their head at ../ and default creds in 2025 ).

https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2025-04-10/#SECURITY-3565

In jenkins/ssh-agent Docker images 6.11.1 and earlier, SSH host keys are generated on image creation for images based on Debian, causing all containers based on images of the same version use the same SSH host keys, allowing attackers able to insert themselves into the network path between the SSH client (typically the Jenkins controller) and SSH build agent to impersonate the latter.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-32754

In jenkins/ssh-slave Docker images based on Debian, SSH host keys are generated on image creation for images based on Debian, causing all containers based on images of the same version use the same SSH host keys, allowing attackers able to insert themselves into the network path between the SSH client (typically the Jenkins controller) and SSH build agent to impersonate the latter.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-32755

##

CVE-2025-0362
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.01%

updated 2025-04-10T15:31:55

1 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 7.7 before 17.8.7, 17.9 before 17.9.6, and 17.10 before 17.10.4. Under certain conditions, an attacker could potentially trick users into unintentionally authorizing sensitive actions on their behalf.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-10T13:44:02.000Z ##

GitLab released an upgrade fixing some vulns. Depending on your architecture and user base, probably nothing too serious, but worth checking out. Especially worth checking out if you're looking to chain some vulns in a target system.

https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2025/04/09/patch-release-gitlab-17-10-4-released/

Denial of service via CI pipelines

A Denial of Service (DoS) issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all up to 17.8.7, 17.9 prior to 17.9.6 and 17.10 prior to 17.10.4. A denial of service could occur upon injecting oversized payloads into CI pipeline exports. This is a medium severity issue (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H, 6.5). It is now mitigated in the latest release and is assigned CVE-2025-1677.

Thanks pwnie for reporting this vulnerability through our HackerOne bug bounty program.

Unintentionally authorizing sensitive actions on users behalf

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 7.7 before 17.8.7, 17.9 before 17.9.6, and 17.10 before 17.10.4. Under certain conditions, an attacker could potentially trick users into unintentionally authorizing sensitive actions on their behalf. This is a medium severity issue (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N, 6.4). It is now mitigated in the latest release and is assigned CVE-2025-0362.

Thanks joaxcar for reporting this vulnerability through our HackerOne bug bounty program.

IP Restriction Bypass through GraphQL Subscription

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 13.12 before 17.8.7, 17.9 before 17.9.6, and 17.10 before 17.10.4. Under certain conditions users could bypass IP access restrictions and view sensitive information. This is a medium severity issue (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N, 5.3). It is now mitigated in the latest release and is assigned CVE-2025-2408.

Thanks rogerace for reporting this vulnerability through our HackerOne bug bounty program.

Unauthorized users can list the number of confidential issues

An issue has been discovered in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 17.1 before 17.8.7, 17.9 before 17.9.6, and 17.10 before 17.10.4, This allows attackers to perform targeted searches with sensitive keywords to get the count of issues containing the searched term. This is a medium severity issue (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N, 5.3). It is now mitigated in the latest release and is assigned CVE-2024-11129

Thanks a92847865 for reporting this vulnerability through our HackerOne bug bounty program

Debugging Information Disclosed

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 17.9 before 17.9.6, and 17.10 before 17.10.4. The runtime profiling data of a specific service was accessible to unauthenticated users. This is a low severity issue (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N, 3.7). It is now mitigated in the latest release and is assigned CVE-2025-2469.

Thanks ap-wtioit for reporting this vulnerability through our HackerOne bug bounty program.

This is a medium severity issue (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N, 6.4). It is now mitigated in the latest release and is assigned CVE-2025-0362.

Thanks joaxcar for reporting this vulnerability through our HackerOne bug bounty program.

IP Restriction Bypass through GraphQL Subscription

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 13.12 before 17.8.7, 17.9 before 17.9.6, and 17.10 before 17.10.4. Under certain conditions users could bypass IP access restrictions and view sensitive information. This is a medium severity issue (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N, 5.3). It is now mitigated in the latest release and is assigned CVE-2025-2408.

Thanks rogerace for reporting this vulnerability through our HackerOne bug bounty program.

Unauthorized users can list the number of confidential issues

An issue has been discovered in GitLab EE affecting all versions from 17.1 before 17.8.7, 17.9 before 17.9.6, and 17.10 before 17.10.4, This allows attackers to perform targeted searches with sensitive keywords to get the count of issues containing the searched term. This is a medium severity issue (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N, 5.3). It is now mitigated in the latest release and is assigned CVE-2024-11129

Thanks a92847865 for reporting this vulnerability through our HackerOne bug bounty program

Debugging Information Disclosed

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 17.9 before 17.9.6, and 17.10 before 17.10.4. The runtime profiling data of a specific service was accessible to unauthenticated users. This is a low severity issue (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N, 3.7). It is now mitigated in the latest release and is assigned CVE-2025-2469.

Thanks ap-wtioit for reporting this vulnerability through our HackerOne bug bounty program.

##

CVE-2025-22375(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2025-04-10T12:31:27

1 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability was found in Videx's CyberAudit-Web. Through the exploitation of a logic flaw, an attacker could create a valid session without any credentials. This vulnerability has been patched in versions later than 9.5Â and a patch has been made available to all instances of CyberAudit-Web, including the versions that are End of Maintenance (EOM). Anyone that requires su

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-10T13:52:32.000Z ##

Cyber Audit Web sounds like a fun system to breach.

https://csirt.divd.nl/cases/DIVD-2024-00043/

sev:CRIT 9.3 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/S:N/AU:Y/R:A/V:D/RE:L/U:Green

An authentication bypass vulnerability was found in Videx's CyberAudit-Web. Through the exploitation of a logic flaw, an attacker could create a valid session without any credentials. This vulnerability has been patched in versions later than 9.5 and a patch has been made available to all instances of CyberAudit-Web, including the versions that are End of Maintenance (EOM). Anyone that requires support with the resolution of this issue can contact support@videx.com for assistance.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22375

sev:MED 6.0 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:H/VI:N/VA:N/SC:L/SI:L/SA:N/S:N/AU:Y/R:A/V:D/RE:L/U:Green

A Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability was discovered in the videx-legacy-ssl web service of Videxâs CyberAudit-Web, affecting versions prior to 1.1.3. This vulnerability has been patched in versions after 1.1.3. Leaving this vulnerability unpatched could lead to unauthorized access to the underlying infrastructure.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22374

##

CVE-2025-3102
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.13%

updated 2025-04-10T06:30:24

3 posts

The SureTriggers: All-in-One Automation Platform plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to an authentication bypass leading to administrative account creation due to a missing empty value check on the 'secret_key' value in the 'autheticate_user' function in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.78. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to create administrator accounts on the target web

1 repos

https://github.com/xxmarcosrobertoxx/vanda-CVE-2025-3102

AAKL at 2025-04-11T16:57:03.121Z ##

Bitdefender: Threat Actors Exploit CVE-2025-3102, a High-Severity Bypass Vulnerability in WordPress Plugin https://www.bitdefender.com/en-us/blog/hotforsecurity/threat-actors-exploit-high-severity-bypass-vulnerability-in-wordpress-plugin @bitdefenderlabs #cybersecurity #infosec #WordPress

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-11T16:57:03.000Z ##

Bitdefender: Threat Actors Exploit CVE-2025-3102, a High-Severity Bypass Vulnerability in WordPress Plugin https://www.bitdefender.com/en-us/blog/hotforsecurity/threat-actors-exploit-high-severity-bypass-vulnerability-in-wordpress-plugin @bitdefenderlabs #cybersecurity #infosec #WordPress

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-11T06:17:59.000Z ##

Yikes, looks like OttoKit/SureTriggers for WordPress is causing some serious trouble again! ð¤¦ââï¸

We're talking a nasty Authorization Bypass (CVE-2025-3102, if you need the specifics) that basically lets attackers waltz right in and create their own admin accounts. Not good.

Seriously, updating to version 1.0.79 isn't just recommended, it's *crucial*. Don't leave the door wide open for attackers! Plus, your clients will definitely appreciate you keeping their sites safe from this kind of mess.

It's situations like these that really highlight something important: While automated scans have their place, they simply can't replace a thorough pentest. That's how you uncover these deeper, critical vulnerabilities.

So, take a moment and double-check your WordPress installations, folks!

Speaking of which, quick question for the community: What are your favorite, must-have WordPress security plugins? Drop your recommendations below! ð

#wordpress #security #pentest #infosec

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27690

sev:HIGH 7.0 - CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 9.4.0.0 through 9.10.0.1, contains an incorrect authorization vulnerability. An unauthenticated attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability to access the cluster with previous privileges of a disabled user account.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26330

sev:MED 6.5 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26480

sev:LOW 3.3 - CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-23378

sev:LOW 3.1 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N

sev:HIGH 7.0 - CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 9.4.0.0 through 9.10.0.1, contains an incorrect authorization vulnerability. An unauthenticated attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability to access the cluster with previous privileges of a disabled user account.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26330

sev:MED 6.5 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22471

sev:MED 5.3 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L

1 posts

In a DS-Lite (Dual-Stack Lite) and NAT (Network Address Translation) scenario, when crafted IPv6 traffic is received andÂ prefix-length is set to 56,Â the ports assigned to

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-04-09T19:59:36.000Z ##

Have a couple Juniper CVEs, in case you get bored.

https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2025-04-Security-Bulletin-Junos-OS-MX-Series-In-DS-lite-and-NAT-senario-receipt-of-crafted-IPv4-traffic-causes-port-block-CVE-2025-21594

sev:HIGH 8.7 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:L/R:U

An Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions vulnerability in the pfe (packet forwarding engine) of Juniper Networks Junos OS on MX Series causes a port within a pool to be blocked leading to Denial of Service (DoS).

In a DS-Lite (Dual-Stack Lite) and NAT (Network Address Translation) scenario, when crafted IPv6 traffic is received and prefix-length is set to 56, the ports assigned to the user will not be freed. Eventually, users cannot establish new connections. Affected FPC/PIC need to be manually restarted to recover.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-21594

https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2025-04-Security-Bulletin-Junos-OS-An-unauthenticated-adjacent-attacker-sending-a-malformed-DHCP-packet-causes-jdhcpd-to-crash-CVE-2025-21591

sev:HIGH 7.1 - CVSS:4.0/AV:A/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:L/AU:Y/R:U/V:C/RE:M/U:Green

A Buffer Access with Incorrect Length Value vulnerability in the jdhcpd daemon of Juniper Networks Junos OS, when DHCP snooping is enabled, allows an unauthenticated, adjacent, attacker to send a DHCP packet with a malformed DHCP option to cause jdhcp to crash creating a Denial of Service (DoS) condition.

Continuous receipt of these DHCP packets using the malformed DHCP Option will create a sustained Denial of Service (DoS) condition.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-21591

BentoML is a Python library for building online serving systems optimized for AI apps and model inference. Prior to 1.4.8, there was an insecure deserialization in BentoML's runner server. By setting specific headers and parameters in the POST request, it is possible to execute any unauthorized arbitrary code on the server, which will grant the attackers to have the initial access and information disclosure on the server. This vulnerability is fixed in 1.4.8.

CVE-2024-8176
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.74%

updated 2025-04-09T09:32:30

1 posts

A stack overflow vulnerability exists in the libexpat library due to the way it handles recursive entity expansion in XML documents. When parsing an XML document with deeply nested entity references, libexpat can be forced to recurse indefinitely, exhausting the stack space and causing a crash. This issue could lead to denial of service (DoS) or, in some cases, exploitable memory corruption, depen

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-04-09T15:35:57.000Z ##

Regarding CVE-2025-29824, the vuln in CLFS linked to a ransomware group.

First off, Microsoft write up is good (aside from the eyeroll attempt to sell Copilot, using no useful functionality).

Also, blog actually mentions it's a zero day - MS need to keep _consistently_ calling zero days in its own products zero days.

Microsoft don't say when exploitation started - but I just crawled some EDR telemetry with a friendly vendor, looks like it goes back at least 9 months.

https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2025/04/08/exploitation-of-clfs-zero-day-leads-to-ransomware-activity/

##
